Pep Guardiola has hit out at the ‘unacceptable’ treatment of Arsene Wenger. 
At the end of a week in which the Manchester City manager has also seen his close friend Luis Enrique come under pressure at Barcelona, Guardiola claimed there was no respect shown towards his colleagues. 
Wenger’s reign at Arsenal has come under scrutiny following the Champions League humiliation at the hands of Bayern Munich last week, when they lost 5-1 in the first leg of their last 16 tie at the Allianz Arena. 
Barca are also facing elimination from Europe following their 4-0 defeat to Paris St Germain. 
That result prompted claims in Spain that Lionel Messi is desperate for a reunion with Guardiola at the Nou Camp. 
The Catalan has dismissed any chance of a return to his former club - and following City’s goalless draw with Huddersfield in the fifth round of the FA Cup on Saturday, spoke in support of his colleagues. Guardiola claims treatment of managers is unacceptable 
“What I’ve heard in the last 10 days about what the people - former players and journalists - (how they) treated for example Arsene Wenger is unacceptable,” he said. 
“For me, (in) our job at the moment we don’t have any respect for any position. 
“What happened was unacceptable. 
“We take decisions and you can say whatever you want.” 
Guardiola clearly wanted to make a statement, with his defence of Wenger unprompted. 
Rather, he was asked about his own decision to name a weakened team against Championship promotion-chasing Huddersfield that now means City will have to squeeze a replay into an increasingly congested calendar. 
Pep Guardiola's biggest Man City error confirmed by one name in his Huddersfield line up 
“I take my decisions and you analyse them after,” he said. “I have to take the decision before. 
“The best solution was what I’d done. After if you don’t agree then you can write.” 
Guardiola rested key players Kevin de Bruyne, Leroy Sane, Raheem Sterling, David Silva and Yaya Toure for the trip to the John Smith’s Stadium. 
All are expected to be recalled for Tuesday’s Champions League tie with Monaco before City head to Abu Dhabi for warm weather training. 
Should City progress in Europe they face a potential fixture pile-up, with the derby with Manchester United already postponed due to Jose Mourinho’s side’s involvement in the Capital One Cup on Sunday.
